title.narrative: EDUCATION - IMPLEMENTATION

description.narrative: Improved capacity of schools, particularly in the most deprived areas, to provide good quality education and integrate more out-of- school children., which contributes to Early Childhood Development, Early Learning, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Operations Support To Programme Delivery. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, Botswana fully implements policies and programmes towards the achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals and targets and national aspirations.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Improved capacity of schools, particularly in the most deprived areas, to provide good quality education and integrate more out-of- school children.

description.narrative: The development of the national remediation and enrichment programme has highlighted opportunities for improvement of access to quality education and uptake of this will ultimately result in improved learning outcomes in primary and secondary schools; the development of the National Language Policy and learning materials for 11 selected languages will increase access to education for children in the most marginalised communities of Botswana; Furthermore UNICEF provided psychosocial support for 6,800 learners and 2,750 teaching staff who have been affected by COVID 19 as well as continued technical support to response to COVID 19 in the education sector. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:29/12/2021
